title: Simple circuits - charge flow through A and-or B

content.question: A circuit is created with a battery, two resistors, and an open switch, as shown in the figure. Which of the following statements is correct about the current in Resistor <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and the current in Resistor <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub A is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="I sub B equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="I sub A equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="I sub B is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="I sub A is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="I sub B is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="I sub A equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="I sub B equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub A equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="I sub B is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
